location_nodata: I could not find any location data for __name__ .
location_nouser: I could not find any location data.

notifications.user_added: User __name__ has been added to the user data
notifications.fence_added: Geofence __name__ has been added to the user data

server.use_broker: Use a MQTT broker as addition to HTTP
server.server_explanation: You need to specify a broker where the Owntracks client can connect to. The servername can either be a local ip adres when using a private broker, or a FQDN. You also need to provide the portnumber. Normally this would be port 1883 and 8883 for secure connections
server.tls: Use a secure connection to the broker (TLS)
server.selfsigned: Disable certificate checking (by use of selfsigned certificates

client.accuracy_explanation: Sometimes the location accuracy can be very low (i.e. accuracy > 50 meters). This could result in an unwanted event regarding enterin / leaving a geofence. If the location accuracy is below the set value, that event is ignored.
client.doublevent_explanation: If the accuracy of a device is too low, the device can move out of the geofence (but the app does not process this). If the accuracy is within limits, it can occur that the device re-enters a geofence and as such triggers an enter/leave event. This option aims to prevent this from happening.

data.data_explanation: This app collects data from users, such as usernames and geofences. This data is used to fill menu's from where you can select a user and a geofence. Use the Delete data button to purge alle the user data.
data.data_purge_confirm: Are you sure you want to purge the user data?

messages.data_purged: The user data has been removed
messages.data_purged_failed: An error occured during the removal of the user data
messages.fencedate_pushed: Fence data has been pushed to the device
messages.fencedate_pushed_failed: Error occured when pushing Fence data to device
